ETYMOLOGY: From English 'probable' (from Old French 'probable', from Latin 'probabilis' 'provable, credible', from 'probare' 'to test, prove') + suffix '-ly'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb modifies a verb, an adjective, or another adverb, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It will probably rain tomorrow, so don't forget your umbrella.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 明天很可能会下雨，所以别忘了带伞。
